column6: Jan. 1 (Xinhua) — Cambodia’s famed Angkor Archaeological Park earned 116.6 million U.S. dollars from selling tickets to foreign tourists in 2018
column7: up eight percent from a year earlier
column8: said a press release on Tuesday.------The ancient site received 2.59 million international tourists last year
column10: said the release from the state-owned Angkor Enterprise
column11: which is responsible for ticket sales at the park.------China is still the largest source of tourists to the park
column12: as South Korea and the United States rank second and third
column13: respectively.------The entrance fee to the site is 37 U.S. dollars for a one-day visit
column15: and 72 dollars for a week-long pass.------Located in northwest Cambodia’s Siem Reap province
column17: inscribed on the World Heritage List of the United Nations Educational
column19: is the country’s most popular tourist destination. ------http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-01/01/c_137712257.htm
